guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

body: Conservatives (as they were until very recently) would also be leftists back then, and the democrats would be left too but further *right*. In those days left and right meant little more than anti-monarchy and monarchy. While today a monarchy would be overall a leftist system.

guild.description:
Rules: Only one, you can say or post whatever without fear of exile, but you can't block me to prevent response.

@Burnside don't exile for troll posts. I invited you as a backup to prevent this takeover from happening again. Please don't abuse it. I'm banned so this is my only form of communication.

Sieged 12/25/20

This is why I said "screenshot this" on my bio.

Carpfag told me days ago something was being planned and he "couldn't wait". I didn't doubt it. Funny this doesn't happen to leftists...

https://ruqqus.com/+AgainstChudGuilds/post/638i/multiple-bigotnazi-guilds-sieged-and-cleaned

This was a coordinated attack, don't let captain tell you he wasn't in on it. My notifications show IMMEDIATE siege the second I was overthrown, every guild. They knew my ban was coming. I got overthrown messages before my ban message.

Every guild was taken over by an alt with minimal points and given to the admin cronies. If you need 250 to create, why can -5 siege?

body: Which is exactly my point. Trump is *not* a fascist. In fact Nazis actually believe him to be a jewish shill (נאצים טיפשים). I don't care for Trump but he's not an alt-right lunatic like the media portrays him. He's a populist, someone who embodies an anti-establishment campaign in a cocky manner that appeals to the masses. I think he's a real jerk and he can be authoritarian about some things because he's *always* right and the greatest and can never be wrong so everyone should just listen to him <sup>/s</sup>, but he isn't out to be a dictator and control people in general, he's pretty much just pursuing his own agenda and doesn't care what the hell anyone else does as long as they don't get in his way. He isn't a racist or phobic either, even though he gives insults that make him sound like it. He couldn't care less as long as he wins. I do however admire his zeal to get rid of corrupt powers and I think he does have an honest motive to save America and the people, even though he can't be fully trusted for reasons I outlined above.
body_html: Which is exactly my point. Trump is not a fascist. In fact Nazis actually believe him to be a jewish shill (נאצים טיפשים). I don't care for Trump but he's not an alt-right lunatic like the media portrays him. He's a populist, someone who embodies an anti-establishment campaign in a cocky manner that appeals to the masses. I think he's a real jerk and he can be authoritarian about some things because he's always right and the greatest and can never be wrong so everyone should just listen to him /s, but he isn't out to be a dictator and control people in general, he's pretty much just pursuing his own agenda and doesn't care what the hell anyone else does as long as they don't get in his way. He isn't a racist or phobic either, even though he gives insults that make him sound like it. He couldn't care less as long as he wins. I do however admire his zeal to get rid of corrupt powers and I think he does have an honest motive to save America and the people, even though he can't be fully trusted for reasons I outlined above.

parent.body: I've had the misfortune of interacting with a few "Daily Stormer Enthusiast" types personally over the years, and my ex was one of them (it was the straw that broke the camel's back). Yes. Every one of them hated Trump.
parent.body_html: I've had the misfortune of interacting with a few "Daily Stormer Enthusiast" types personally over the years, and my ex was one of them (it was the straw that broke the camel's back). Yes. Every one of them hated Trump.

body: Yeah but I'm always the little guy who doesn't really do anything right. That's the most any of my idea posts ever get to, while other peoples' easily skyrocket super high. It's been a theme of my life, that any time I have any kind of goal it doesn't work out, things never fail to go impossibly wrong. Every. Single. Time. And I think the only explanation is that I suck that bad. I can try super hard at something for years and most other people still easily overcome almost every obstacle I face. It's probably because I don't have the right genes for intelligent endeavors, I'm a guy with a lineage of mostly simpler people. Which is fine but I unfortunately have no interest in that and I'm trying to succeed at things that simply don't match my skillset. Try what I like and be a miserable failure. Do what I'm made for and hate it. I'm doomed to hate my life either way.
body_html: Yeah but I'm always the little guy who doesn't really do anything right. That's the most any of my idea posts ever get to, while other peoples' easily skyrocket super high. It's been a theme of my life, that any time I have any kind of goal it doesn't work out, things never fail to go impossibly wrong. Every. Single. Time. And I think the only explanation is that I suck that bad. I can try super hard at something for years and most other people still easily overcome almost every obstacle I face. It's probably because I don't have the right genes for intelligent endeavors, I'm a guy with a lineage of mostly simpler people. Which is fine but I unfortunately have no interest in that and I'm trying to succeed at things that simply don't match my skillset. Try what I like and be a miserable failure. Do what I'm made for and hate it. I'm doomed to hate my life either way.

parent.body: You had dozens of upvotes and 45 comments on your post, I would hardly say it was a failure - your idea is what set me thinking - we all just build off each other :)
parent.body_html: You had dozens of upvotes and 45 comments on your post, I would hardly say it was a failure - your idea is what set me thinking - we all just build off each other :)

body: Unfortunately you're one of the few ones left that still believes that. Most "conservatives" now seem to think that these things are problems for society that must be eradicated. Untraditional ideas cannot be tolerated they say, and minorities are causing societal decay. They no longer believe in the constitution or the US, they are looking to monarchism or fascism to create a strong state enforcing their ideas (and not even a constitutional one). Completely the opposite of what they were only a year ago, and pretty much what the media always slandered them as being. Perhaps when antifa communist revolutionaries pretending to be anarchists cause 9 billion dollars of property damage and SJWs screech nonstop about systemic discrimination and privilege or whatever, it makes conservatives begin to subconsciously associate lack of government and minorities with them and this is their reaction. It's fear, I think, and they're in fight or flight mode.

They no longer believe in the constitution or the US, they are looking to monarchism or fascism to create a strong state enforcing their ideas (and not even a constitutional one). Completely the opposite of what they were only a year ago, and pretty much what the media always slandered them as being. Perhaps when antifa communist revolutionaries pretending to be anarchists cause 9 billion dollars of property damage and SJWs screech nonstop about systemic discrimination and privilege or whatever, it makes conservatives begin to subconsciously associate lack of government and minorities with them and this is their reaction. It's fear, I think, and they're in fight or flight mode.

parent.body:
Why do you keep attributing positions to me that I haven’t taken?  Where did I say I wanted ANY of those things?  I think you’re confusing authoritarianism with a government. Fascism is a government system that can embody those things, for lack of a better term governing systems are nouns, they are things a collection of beliefs. Authoritarianism is a verb, it’s the method used to secure those beliefs. 

I am a constitutional republic authoritarian. I believe in the USA as it was founded, and I am willing to use force to bring it back there. For example I have no problem with commies spouting their shit tier ideology online but the second they try to intimidate people with violence they are terrorists and I’ll use my authoritarian tactics to treat them as such. I have no problem with gays on campus or anywhere else but when they exclude others I have no problem with FORCE to get that back.

Authoritarianism is a verb, it’s the method used to secure those beliefs.

I am a constitutional republic authoritarian. I believe in the USA as it was founded, and I am willing to use force to bring it back there. For example I have no problem with commies spouting their shit tier ideology online but the second they try to intimidate people with violence they are terrorists and I’ll use my authoritarian tactics to treat them as such. I have no problem with gays on campus or anywhere else but when they exclude others I have no problem with FORCE to get that back.

post.body:
For the longest time conservatism was *defined* by a belief in the constitution, states rights, small government, free speech, individual freedom, and free markets. In a nutshell it had the same idea as libertarianism, but more moderate and more oriented toward patriotism. I am a libertarian, and we used to be friends. But you've changed. This year conservatives have entirely abandoned their ideals, in favor of fascism, something they once strongly condemned as a socialist ideology (I don't mean Hitler when I say fascism, I just mean the general idea of authright). They think we need to enact tough laws on minorities, speech offensive to them, and basically all dissent. They're beginning to turn to anti-american forms of government such as monarchy and dictatorship as they believe things need to get under firm control and "return to tradition". Just in the past year, most of the media's accusations of them have gone from complete bullshit to true. When I asked a question about this in +Conservative, [I got exiled](https://ruqqus.com/+general/post/6w6x/exiled-from-conservative-for-disagreeing-with) because the person I disagreed with happened to be a guildmaster.

I have a theory. I think it's no wonder that conservatives have started to think this way after all the left's bullshit. And this year was especially bad.

![](https://i.imgur.com/Yxhawkb.jpg)

With all this political correctness bullshit, and all these tantrums, I think it's no wonder conservatives are starting to have negative thoughts towards the people the left is "defending". When they see black people, they are reminded of the "white privilege" fragility that caused BLM and Antifa riots this summer. Even though it's mostly white people doing it, seeing a black person now reminds them of this, and they are now associated with it. Nice going leftists. Same with small government, as many of the rioters falsely portrayed themselves as "anarchists" it made conservatives fear lack of government control and shy as far away from that as possible. Thanks to that there is now virtually no difference between "liber"al and "conservative", except culturally.

So yeah, you leftists have really made conservatives react and actually become fascist racist everything-phobics. And it's thanks to your tantrums and constant PC demands that caused them to associate them with your bullshit, and now they react accordingly. I suppose the deep state is happy though. The few real conservatives left and their libertarian friends are doomed. And with them, America.

Just in the past year, most of the media's accusations of them have gone from complete bullshit to true. When I asked a question about this in +Conservative, I got exiled because the person I disagreed with happened to be a guildmaster.

I have a theory. I think it's no wonder that conservatives have started to think this way after all the left's bullshit. And this year was especially bad.

With all this political correctness bullshit, and all these tantrums, I think it's no wonder conservatives are starting to have negative thoughts towards the people the left is "defending". Even though it's mostly white people doing it, seeing a black person now reminds them of this, and they are now associated with it. Nice going leftists. Same with small government, as many of the rioters falsely portrayed themselves as "anarchists" it made conservatives fear lack of government control and shy as far away from that as possible. Thanks to that there is now virtually no difference between "liber"al and "conservative", except culturally.

So yeah, you leftists have really made conservatives react and actually become fascist racist everything-phobics. And it's thanks to your tantrums and constant PC demands that caused them to associate them with your bullshit, and now they react accordingly. I suppose the deep state is happy though. The few real conservatives left and their libertarian friends are doomed. And with them, America.

body: That part is true, but your new plans of strong government, ethnostate, censorship and enforcement of "traditional values" after doing so is absolutely not necessary.

parent.body: You can’t drive people out without authoritarianism. You can ask them to leave but they can tell you to fuck off. You need actual authority to MAKE them leave.
parent.body_html: You can’t drive people out without authoritarianism. You can ask them to leave but they can tell you to fuck off. You need actual authority to MAKE them leave.

body:
I don't understand. Is revolution authoritarian? I suppose if you're communist but otherwise it usually means driving *out* the elite rulers. Taking away power is *against* the authoritarianism, which is what conservatives always wanted to do. Unless you plan to take that power for yourself instead of actually getting rid of it, then it's a different matter. And that's what conservatives seem to have been suddenly wanting lately.

And no, I don't think voting works which is why it's important to have as little government as possible, since it's *always* corrupt and favoring of special interests.
body_html:
I don't understand. Is revolution authoritarian? I suppose if you're communist but otherwise it usually means driving out the elite rulers. Taking away power is against the authoritarianism, which is what conservatives always wanted to do. Unless you plan to take that power for yourself instead of actually getting rid of it, then it's a different matter. And that's what conservatives seem to have been suddenly wanting lately.

And no, I don't think voting works which is why it's important to have as little government as possible, since it's always corrupt and favoring of special interests.

parent.body:
How do you accomplish these things without authoritarianism?  You cannot take power from someone who has it without authority or the willingness to use force. In order to take power from those who wrongly have it you must use force and authority. You don’t actually think voting works do you?

You saw the results of this last election right?  The government will fake an entire pandemic, tank tons of small businesses and withhold aid to their own citizens to ensure the vote goes their way.

body: Fighting back doesn't mean you have to be authoritarian. You can take down the swamp without forcing the people to conform to your beliefs. Actually the best thing to do now probably is to just gut the entire government and start over from scratch. But that means getting *rid* of all those totalitarian special interests, and putting more checks in place to prevent them from happening again. We are still learning from our past mistakes. But if you go the authoritarian route, then you become just like them, so what are you at war for exactly?
body_html: Fighting back doesn't mean you have to be authoritarian. You can take down the swamp without forcing the people to conform to your beliefs. Actually the best thing to do now probably is to just gut the entire government and start over from scratch. But that means getting rid of all those totalitarian special interests, and putting more checks in place to prevent them from happening again. We are still learning from our past mistakes. But if you go the authoritarian route, then you become just like them, so what are you at war for exactly?

parent.body:
Fuck that we are at war. Your bullshit ideals mean nothing, these people hate you just like they hate me and allowing their ideas to fester unchecked is what got us here. Most people on the right have become more authoritarian, that I will grant you and I will also grant you this is the left’s fault. Thing is, the old ideals were luxuries of a forgotten time and playing “by the book” only works when the other side isn’t willing to lie and cheat. 

Open up your eyes, libertarianism is dead.  Conservatism is dead.  What are we conserving exactly?  Our government doesn’t represent the people only special interests and career politicians. Our representatives don’t care about our children or their future and the idea of the United States doesn’t even exist anymore. It’s all because too many people on the right sat back and played by the rules while the left outright made shit up and cheated.
parent.body_html:
Fuck that we are at war. Your bullshit ideals mean nothing, these people hate you just like they hate me and allowing their ideas to fester unchecked is what got us here. Most people on the right have become more authoritarian, that I will grant you and I will also grant you this is the left’s fault. Thing is, the old ideals were luxuries of a forgotten time and playing “by the book” only works when the other side isn’t willing to lie and cheat.

Open up your eyes, libertarianism is dead. Conservatism is dead. What are we conserving exactly? Our government doesn’t represent the people only special interests and career politicians. Our representatives don’t care about our children or their future and the idea of the United States doesn’t even exist anymore. It’s all because too many people on the right sat back and played by the rules while the left outright made shit up and cheated.

post.body:
2.2% of the USA is Jewish. The probability of selecting 10 advisors at random and them all being Jewish is 0.022^10 or 2.22•10^(-17), which equals 

0.00000000000000222%

Strangely this is exactly what happened. 🤔
post.body_html:
2.2% of the USA is Jewish. The probability of selecting 10 advisors at random and them all being Jewish is 0.022^10 or 2.22•10^(-17), which equals

0.00000000000000222%

Strangely this is exactly what happened. 🤔
post.title: The statistical probability of Joe Bidens cabinet being entirely Jewish.

body: It doesn't matter whether you agree with him though, the point is the guild is called +Conservative, supposedly for anything related to conservatism, yet you have to agree exactly 100% with the guildmasters on everything or you get exiled, even if you're a conservative. Which is funny because the GMs aren't even conservatives, they're authrightists, so all conservatives will be exiled from +Conservative!

There is zero doubt of fraud. Biden is illegitimate. So are Warnock and ossof as Georgia senators who "won" exactly the same way as Biden did. We are fucking pissed and if you aren't on board you are no better than the democrats

body: Except that the guild is called +Conservative, and nothing I said was at all hostile to conservatism. It just doesn't agree with the exact beliefs of the person who I replied to, which are more alt right than conservative. But since they turned out to be a guildmaster, their response was to ban me like a reddit mod.
body_html: Except that the guild is called +Conservative, and nothing I said was at all hostile to conservatism. It just doesn't agree with the exact beliefs of the person who I replied to, which are more alt right than conservative. But since they turned out to be a guildmaster, their response was to ban me like a reddit mod.

guild.name: general

parent.body:
The platform has freedom of speech. Each guild has its own rules.

Also, even if conservatism support freedom of speech, a club/reunion/guild/whatever it's not necessarily a place to let EVERYONE enter, but rather a place for people with some common ideas to discuss. They would not oppose you to said what you want on another guild, as much as they won't agree with your expulsion of the platform. Learn the difference.

You've made the same basic mistake of people that criticize legislative branch like it's the executive branch of gov:

The president, for instance, has to represent everybody, including those whom didn't vote for him, so he MUST listen and possibly abide to things he dislikes in the name of democracy. That's because he's position is unique, so he must represent EVERYONE. It's the equivalent of the entire platform.

A legislator it's the opposite. He has to attend the specific demands of those whom vote for him, not the whole population, in order to represent them. That's because there's one legislator for each considerable sized group, so they must represent WHO ELECTED THEM. It's why the congress is the "house of the people". It's the equivalent of a guild.

You've made the same basic mistake of people that criticize legislative branch like it's the executive branch of gov:

The president, for instance, has to represent everybody, including those whom didn't vote for him, so he MUST listen and possibly abide to things he dislikes in the name of democracy. That's because he's position is unique, so he must represent EVERYONE. It's the equivalent of the entire platform.

A legislator it's the opposite. He has to attend the specific demands of those whom vote for him, not the whole population, in order to represent them. That's because there's one legislator for each considerable sized group, so they must represent WHO ELECTED THEM. It's why the congress is the "house of the people". It's the equivalent of a guild.
